body.name: ASUS TUF Gaming A520M-PLUS (WiFi) AMD AM4 (3rd Gen Ryzen™) microATX Motherboard (M.2 Support, 802.11ac Wi-Fi, DisplayPort, HDMI, D-Sub, USB 3.2 Gen 1 Type-A and Aura Addressable Gen 2 headers)

features: AMD AM4 Socket: l Ready for Ryzen 5000 Series/ 4000 G-Series/ 3000 Series Desktop Processors
Comprehensive cooling: Large VRM heatsink, PCH heatsink and Fan Xpert 2+
Made for online gaming: 802.11ac Wi-Fi, TUF LANGuard and TurboLAN technology
Gaming Connectivity: BIOS FlashBack button, USB 3.2 Gen 1 Type-A, 32Gb/s M.2 onboard, SATA 6Gb/s, 802.11ac Wi-Fi, DisplayPort/HDMI/D-Sub
Gaming Look and Feel: ASUS-exclusive Aura Sync RGB lighting, including RGB headers and a Gen 2 addressable RGB header for greater customization
body.description: The ASUS TUF GAMING A520M-PLUS WiFi comes battle-hardened with game-ready features and proven durability. Engineered with military-grade components, an upgraded power solution and a comprehensive set of cooling options, this motherboard delivers rock-solid performance and unwavering gaming stability for AMD 3rd Gen Ryzen™ CPUs.

productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.6 4.6 out of 5 stars 731 ratings 4.6 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A great budget board for gaming, office or daily-use
reviews.reviewText: I bought this motherboard to build a PC for my father-in-law. He races on the weekend, and loves looking back at his recordings. He edits videos and puts them on youtube, then goes back to watch them on a daily basis.When his old PC failed, he wanted to go buy a new one at best buy. As a custom/DIY obsessed geek, I had to convince him to let me build him one and get more performance for his money. After doing some research, I determined the Ryzen lineup was the way to go for budget performance.I'm not very familiar with anything AMD, so this was my first non-intel build. For a PC that didn't need all of the bells and whistles, I wanted to get a board that wouldn't cost a bunch more for a bunch of bells and whistles that would never be used. Once I ran across the ASUS TUF lineup of boards, I was pleasantly surprised by the affordability.Fast forward to the assembly and testing process.I got the board, the rest of the parts, and went right to building. The board seems sturdy, and has the luxury of looking like a high-end board, what with fancy heat sinks, 802.11ac wifi on board, displayport & HDMI outputs, LED headers, and USB-C/Gen 3.1 ports. I grew up in a time where wifi included in a board was only for the highest-end custom build boards.Installation was a breeze. Goes the same as any other board, as expected. The only thing I wasn't expecting was that the DDR4 slots install a bit differently than most other boards. Only one side of release tabs will move, the other side is stationary. Once I figured that out, everything went well.I got it powered up, and the BIOS control screen was very user friendly. For a budget board, it's nice to have a BIOS with a well built GUI. Secure Boot 2.0 controls made it easy to get Windows 11 installed and running without a hitch. As most new boards go, drivers weren't much of a necessity to get all of your features and motherboard components working properly.If I end up with another budget AMD build to do in the future, I'll stick with this ASUS TUF board.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 8, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This company is phenomenal. I am beyond impressed by the quality of their service. While mine did arrive DOA, the company quickly sent me a new one, and within 2 days I had a brand new one. I do not live anywhere near an Amazon warehouse. I am beyond impressed by this company; the board feels sturdy and nice. It is a bit tight, though its an MATX, so that's expected.Some things to note.The board does not come with motherboard screws.The IO shield is a little weird and sometimes would go into the ports when I was installing the board which I assume was a user error.Other than that,. The company is phenomenal, and I would definitely recommend going with ASUS for any parts you can afford to pay a bit extra for. You are paying for their phenomenal communication and customer service, as well as their reliable parts.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great MB for the Money!
reviews.reviewText: This was my 1st PC build, the BIOS was really easy to use once the pc was booted up. The MB itself Is great quality and has so great features like wifi and BT that other don't have for the same price. 2 major things for me were the BT because I want to a connect Xbox controllers and speakers for music, also the MB has a LED strip already and you can use the asus board management on the pc to customize the led, it works great with the tower I got!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars It works well and looks good but
reviews.reviewText: It’s a good micro arc motherboard and can be paired very easily with my r5 3600 and rx5700xt. now that being said there were some cons, first off my wifi didn’t work so i had to get a wifi adapter which was another $30 so I’m stoked about that. Also the rgb on the motherboard is really bad, it always has like a green rgb when you want it to white or something like that though it’s hard to in the picture. I’m still trying to get the aura sync to work but that’s on me not the motherboard. So i would sorta recommend if you know how to get everything setup and get you wifi to work!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Works great, outdated though.
reviews.reviewText: Wi-Fi works well, I’m just using it for photoshop. Fast with the m2 hard drive. Gen 3 is outdated at this point, I’m not a computer guy so I really didn’t know at the time when buying. Go for a gen 4 motherboard build. Twice as quick. Motherboard only supports 2133mhz ram. Price is right, all depends on your application.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 30, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Everything as expected. I've been using this mobo over a month without any problems. Using it with a Ryzen 5 5600g

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good price for all the options.
reviews.reviewText: It has all the options for a good gaming PC.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 6, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I used this motherboard for an a entry gaming build without a graphics card. I am not an expert so wanted something easy to work with. This worked out of the box with a Ryzen 5600g. The only thing I had to change in the settings was that by default it was running the DDR4 3200 at 2666mhz but it was easy enough to change it. One issue I ran into is that the port for the on and off switch is further back than normal so the cable for turning the computer on and off from my case does not reach it. I have used the same case for about 15 years and have had several other motherboards and this was never an issue. I had to remove the switch from the normal location of the case and have the wires hanging out of the side of the case.
This motherboard is a great priced to performance mb with lots of IO and a cheap price. Have been using it for multiple months now with no issues. I highly recommend.

Estoy encantado con esta tarjeta madre. Desde el momento en que la instalé en mi sistema, noté una mejora significativa en el rendimiento de mi PC. La compatibilidad con mi procesador y RAM fue perfecta.La calidad de construcción es excepcional, y la administración de cables resultó sencilla gracias a su diseño bien pensado. La estabilidad del sistema ha sido impecable desde la instalación, y he experimentado una menor latencia en juegos y una mayor velocidad en tareas intensivas.

reviews.reviewTitle: Llegó impecable y muy buena placa madre
Great Motherboard as always from ASUS ❤️
reviews.reviewText: Small factor but with all the features of a full fledged ATX motherboard and thankfully to good places as Amazon you get very good deals. I build a PC for my son switching from a Laptop i7/GTX1070 to Ryzen 5 5500/RTX2080 and 64GB DDR4 also M2 and everything flies every ew game runs perfectly. RECOMMENDED.💯

reviews.reviewTitle: Buena tarjeta madre a buen precio....
reviews.reviewText: Una tarjeta madre que da mucho por su precio, quizas sea antigua y no incluya las tecnologias mas actuales (wifi 5 y bluetooth 4.0) pero vale por lo que cuesta.Usada con un Ryzen 5 4500 y 16 Gb. de Ram a 3200 mhz y fuente de poder de 700w...
